reporting-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

title.narrative: Build the capacity of men and women, businesses and government officials in the energy sector in Mexico.

description.narrative: The Energy Strand of the Mexico programme will focus on 3 main interventions: developing the skills of the local workforce; building the capacity of Mexican SMEs to support increased supply chain integration; and capacity building for energy regulators. These interventions will contribute to the promotion of inclusive economic growth and social development, through more productive and resilient men and women, businesses and government officials that are best placed to lead Mexico’s transition to a low carbon economy. Greater development in the energy sector in Mexico will also generate opportunities for international businesses, bringing potential benefits to British business in sectors where they are well placed to compete [Following a methodology change, from financial year 19/20 costs under this activity will be reported against a new activity line. You can find the new IATI identifier by looking up “other identifier information”.]
